title.label: A M A Z I N G

content.label: Ok, so the only reason you WOULDN’T get this game is if you were broke, but I’m broke and I have it so you really don’t have an excuse. It’s amazing, hard enough to be fun/challenging, but easy enough so it’s not frustrating, the storyline and the graphics are great too, and it’s just a 10/10
Well done and awesome graphics

title.label: Decent Castlevania style of game for IOS

content.label: First let me start by saying that the 2D and 2.5D Castlevania games are my favorite games and have been for over 25 years!  With that being said, this is not a Castlevania game, but it in the same style of a Castlevania game, closest I’ve seen yet on IOS.  The graphics are great, the sound experience and music fits the game really well, and the controls, once you get used to them, actually work rather well.  It took me a little to master (or try to master) the controls, especially some of the special moves, but lots of practice and I actually like the control system.  Of course, I’d rather play with a controller and always will prefer a controller.  The gameplay is fun, challenging yet not too difficult as in the early Castlevania games, the save points are strategically placed, and I really enjoyed the story!  One of the best action platformers with RPG elements that I’ve played on IOS and I’ve been playing IOS games for over 8 years now.  I look forward to this company’s next game, and would ask for some possible DLC such as new levels/areas and perhaps stronger weapons.  Excellent game for the money, highly recommend!

There is no doubt about it. Grimvalor is the best game ever created. I’ve played through it 3 times and it still doesn’t get old. Although I do wish the developers would make more games. If you read this you should get the game!!!!

Grimvalor is a great game somewhat derivative of Dark Souls. The controls are responsive and laid out well (I used the touch screen controls), although I found myself using my charged attack quite often and in the wrong direction of the enemy when I was just trying to do a normal attack. The dodge mechanic is super fun and makes you invulnerable for a moment when you time your dodge with an enemies attack, which is fun and challenging and very rewarding when you’ve mastered it. Once I gained the item that slowed enemies down after a successful dodge the game really hits its high point for me. I loved watching them begin their attack and once I flipped behind them they slowed to a crawl as they attacked the air, meanwhile I, now being behind them, unleashed a flurry of attacks. So fun! 
The bad:
Some detractors of the game are the enemy variety, lack of extra content, and short story. I was surprised to see the same enemies from the beginning of the game being recycled and used again multiple times throughout the campaign. The items and forge upgrades that you can buy are very limited and near the end of the game you’ll have many extra resources and not much to spend them on. The weapon selection varies from sword, fist, or axe, with only slight differences between them. I would have like to see a greater variety of weapon choice that could have offered more variety to the repetitive gameplay. The short campaign, and very fun fighting does counter the repetition a little, but by the time I beat the game, I was pretty much done with the game and didn’t see much reason to play a second time through. 
Overall: Great game, sharp controls, short and sweet, worth a play through, but lack of content and repetitive gameplay causes it to fall short of being a must buy.

title.label: You owe it to yourself to try this game

content.label: Grim valor is a great game. Especially if you bought it discounted for Black Friday. But even at full price Grim Valor is a great puzzle game with elements taken from the souls games as well as other platformers. If I had one complaint it would be that you only have a warrior class to play as. I would have liked to at least see an archer/ mage variation. Not a big deal but would provide some alternate ways to play

I don’t usually like playing games like this on mobile because touch controls don’t feel right for action games but this felt perfect. Reminds me a lot of Hollow Knight in terms of the difficulty ramp. When I died I never felt cheated. Definitely a must play!

Action is fluid and swift. Game graphics is smooth and it’s easy to learn and play. In the beginning it got hard right off the back, reminding me like a dark souls. It’s a sided roller that requires no internet or p2w. Definitely recommend this this t.
Best game I’ve played. Absolutely could not get off the phone for 3 days. So good. I wish there were more levels. So so so good. Buy it. You won’t be disappointed
It keeps force shutting down on my iPad.
This game is absolutely amazing. If you love a good story telling, adventure RPG then this is your game. I’ve never seen anything like it on mobile

Very much enjoyed playing this.  There were some times when my dodge didn’t seem to register but the game itself never feels unfair, and I really like how I would start out intimidated by some of the bosses but soon figure out how to deal with them and feel quite accomplished.

The story is very interesting but there isn’t nearly enough of it.  It’s not overly surprising or deep as the villain twist I found QUITE obvious, and there’s a supporting character who barley exists in the game at all and only really helps in the very end.  There is a lot of lore drops though and I hope that if this ever gets turned into a bigger for-console/pc game, that they add a ton more into the story, as well as add more side-quests and customization.

Most of my complaints really stem from “I loved what I got, I just want more” because what is here is definitely worth the price even if the game is short.  I 100% it pretty quickly on my first time, but it was quite fun, and for something limited by iPhone graphics, it looks great, and the designs for the characters are also great even if a bit standard.

In short, I want more.  I would definitely support a kickstarter to make this a bigger thing, be it a sequel or remake.

I love the game very fun and interesting. Has level ups, items, armor, weapons l, and bosses. Just a great fun game. Definitely recommend everyone to try it. It is worth the money. My only issue is on my iPhone 11 it makes my phone get hot after 10 minutes or so. That’s my only issue. Can’t play for a long time or my phone gets really hot. Hope y’all can fix that issue. Idk what is making it get hot. Only game that does it.
There’s too many issues to list. The game is fun, but only 1 Star fun and definitely not $7 fun.

title.label: Best game to date for iPad.

content.label: this game met and beat all of my expectations of N iOS game. Super fun, super good graphics, Greta story.  Enough said. Xoxo. Love you

This is the very FIRST mobile game I have ever bought. It does not disappoint. I love these kind of hack and slash platformers, especially as a quick way to pass the time.
This game’s attack mechanics and dual weapon system work very smoothly along with the dodge and jump mechanics. It feels great to play as a mobile game. Some other roguelikes such as Dead Souls are also very fun, but I love Grimvalor for it’s atmosphere. The lighting and tone of the game is easy on the eyes and suggests a deeper fantasy lore.
I’ve only played a half hour so I don’t know what other features there are to unlock, but just from the very little I’ve experienced, it seems like a very well balanced, and replayable game.
I love the his game it’s so amazing

I love the fact that it’s a fast paste button masher, with a pretty good story line .

title.label: Best Game for Travels/Waiting for a Lecture

content.label: This game is perfect for anyone who is traveling long distances. The leveling is hard enough to get you an amazing feel of challenge but at the same time not give you a sense of frustration. This game is what most other games fail to accomplish: a perfect balance. The hidden weapons and trinkets are hard enough to take you some time to find them but not placed in an impossible place. I only ever had to look up at ONE hidden trinket. I chose a balanced set for my skills. Meaning that I wasn’t putting ALL or most of my skill points on attack or health. Even with that I still was progressing normally and with a healthy amount of difficulty. All of the bosses had fair attacks and phases to the point that if you died it was more of bad planning on your part than bad/faulty programming. The best part of this game though, is that it never forces you to continue on the main storyline. You always have the option to spend hours leveling up or looking for hidden stuff as you try to 100% the game. All of that makes for one hell of a game for traveling or waiting for a class to start, as you will be spending hours piecing together the lore, or just leveling up until you are one-hit killing bosses. Definitely a must have game on any phone!

Not enough content is replaced with an unenjoyable experience of killing the same monsters over and over.  Don’t waste time or money unless you want to be frustrated after a few hours.

This game really earns a 5 star ratting from me. The gameplay, the graphics and over all experience is fun and I can always find myself wanting to keep playing, even when my battery is screaming at me to stop. The combat is fun, addicting and intense when facing harder opponents, mini bosses and the big bads. Which means you have to master the dodge ability, which adds more of a challenge, considering the enemies will rip you a new one.

I only have one miner nit-pick, which is the lack of character customization. And the story isn’t all amazing, but it gets a pass because everything else is so freaking fun.
Controller play sends this beautiful, moody game to that 5star place. Well done.
Great game
Truly amazing game.

I absolutely love this game. It is addictive, and does well causing me to procrastinate work around the house haha, there is one caveat. Something I find highly frustrating. 

At some points, my experience toward the next level is reset before I rest and level up. Causing me to have to hack and slash forever more to try and reach the next level. 

At first I noticed it, thought maybe I overlooked something, or maybe I leveled up and forgot, happened a second time, then I started paying attention. This last time I fought and slept and watched my points go up, almost to the next level, much needed as enemies are getting much tougher. Beat a small boss, and then went through to a new stage and found a sleep point. Surely it was level up time. It’s taking so much to defeat even the smaller guys,
But nope, my experience points reset and I was back to the beginning of the level of my hero.

It is highly frustrating and making the game hard to progress like this. Am I missing something? Do experience points not roll over to the next stage? Or is this a bug?

I should be well beyond the level my character is at, if developers could possibly fix my issue, look into it, or maybe push me to the character level I should be at, it would make things much better for my experience. 
I am at the point where I’m not sure I want to continue with this game, it takes so much to push through right now. 

Spent two days on this last boss battle when it should not have.

Any help is appreciated.

-William
I’m going to make it short and simple this game is everything you can ask for and is very hard to impress me but I was impressed 😉
